contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the Holy Spirit will empower him" or "the Holy Spirit will guide him." Make sure it does not sound similar to what an evil spirit might do to a person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he will be filled with the Holy Spirit

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God sent me to speak to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: I was sent to speak to you

contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) "people will call him" or 2) "God will call him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: will be called

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the message that the Lord gave to her" or "the things that the Lord told you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the things that were told her from the Lord

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The Holy Spirit filled his father Zechariah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: His father Zechariah was filled with the Holy Spirit

contextId.information: People will realize that he is a prophet. This can be stated in active form. AT: "people will know that you are a prophet" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you, child, will be called a prophet

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that they register all the people living in the world" or "that they count all the people in the world and write down their names" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that a census be taken of all the people living in the world

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "what the angels had told the shepherds" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: what had been said to them

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "what the shepherds told them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: what was spoken to them by the shepherds

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the name the angel had called him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the name he had been given by the angel

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "As Moses wrote" or "They did this because Moses wrote" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: As it is written

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The Holy Spirit had shown him" or "The Holy Spirit had told him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: It had been revealed to him by the Holy Spirit

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "As the Holy Spirit directed him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Led by the Spirit

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the things that Simeon said about him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the things which were spoken concerning him

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that the law of the Lord required them to do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: they were required to do according to the law of the Lord

contextId.information: Verses 4-6 are a quotation from Isaiah. They can be stated in active form. AT: "This happened as Isaiah the prophet had written in his book" or "John fulfilled the words that the prophet Isaiah had written in his book" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: As it is written ... prophet

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "for John to baptize them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: to be baptized by him

contextId.information: The ax that is in position so it can cut the roots of a tree is a metaphor for the punishment that is about to begin. It can be stated in active form. AT: "God is like the man who has placed his ax against the root of the trees" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: now the ax is set against the root of the trees

contextId.information: "fire" is also a metaphor for punishment. This can be stated in active form. AT: "throws it into the fire" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: thrown into the fire

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "for John to baptize them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: to be baptized

contextId.information: This is passive to show that the tax collector's authority comes from Rome. AT: "than what the Romans have authorized you to take" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: than you have been ordered to collect

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the devil tempted him there to disobey God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: was tempted by the devil

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Moses has written in the scriptures" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: It is written

contextId.information: Those who heard Jesus told other people about him, and then those other people told even more people about him. This can be stated in active form. AT: "people spread the news about Jesus" or "people told other people about Jesus" or "knowledge about him was passed on from person to person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: news about him spread

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Someone gave him the scroll of the prophet Isaiah" (See [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The scroll of the prophet Isaiah was handed to him

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "this is the reason God sent me here" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: this is the reason I was sent here

contextId.information: "the report about him went out even farther." This can be stated in active form. AT: "people kept telling the news about him in other places" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the report about him spread even farther

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "for Jesus to heal them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: to be healed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "he had power to heal people" or "he used his power to heal people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: power to heal was coming out from him

contextId.information: Jesus did not say who would not judge. Possible meanings are 1) "God will not judge you" or 2) "no one will judge you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you will not be judged

contextId.information: Jesus did not say who would not condemn. Possible meanings are 1) "God will not condemn you" or 2) "no one will condemn you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you will not be condemned

contextId.information: Jesus did not say exactly who would give. Possible meanings are 1) "someone will give it to you" or 2) "God will give it to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it will be given to you

contextId.information: Jesus did not say exactly who would measure. Possible meanings are 1) "they will measure things back to you" or 2) "God will measure things back to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it will be measured back to you

contextId.information: People recognize the kind of tree by the fruit it bears. This can be stated in active form. AT: "people know the type of a tree" or "people recognize a tree" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: each tree is known

contextId.information: "because the man had built it well" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: because it had been well built

contextId.information: "fear filled all of them." This can be stated in active form. AT: "they all became very afraid" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: fear overcame all of them

contextId.information: "has come to be with us" or "has appeared to us." This can be stated in active form. AT: "God has raised a great prophet among us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: has been raised among us

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will bless the person who does not stop believing in me because of my actions" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The person who does not stop believing in me because of my actions is blessed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "because they had let John baptize them" or "because John had baptized them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: because they had been baptized with the baptism of John

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "they did not let John baptize them" or "they rejected John's baptism" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: they had not been baptized by John

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT:  "God has forgiven her many sins" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: her sins, which were many, have been forgiven

contextId.information: "You are forgiven." This can be stated in active form. AT: "I forgive your sins" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Your sins are forgiven

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "whom Jesus had set free from evil spirits and healed of diseases" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: who had been healed of evil spirits and diseases

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Jesus had driven out seven demons" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: seven demons had been driven out

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "people walked on it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it was trampled underfoot

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God has given to you the knowledge of ... God" or "God has made you able to understand ... God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The knowledge of ... God has been given to you

contextId.information: Since this is the devil's purpose, it can be translated as: AT: "because the devil thinks, 'They must not believe and they must not be saved'" or "so they will not believe with the result that God saves them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: so they may not believe and be saved

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the cares and riches and pleasures of this life choke them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: they are choked ... pleasures of this life

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "People told him" or "Someone told him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: He was told

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "though the people had bound him with chains and shackles and guarded him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: hough he was bound ... and kept under guard

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Jesus had healed the man that demons had controlled"(See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the man who had been controlled by demons had been healed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "they became very afraid" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: they were overwhelmed with great fear

contextId.information: These phrases can be stated in active form. AT: "some people said ... and others said ... and others said" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it was said by some ... and it was said ... and still others

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the Son of Man will also be ashamed of him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: of him will the Son of Man be ashamed

contextId.information: This can be stated with an active form. AT: "the one I have chosen" or "I have chosen him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the one who is chosen

contextId.information: This can be stated with an active clause. Here "hands" refers to power or control.  AT: "they will betray the Son of Man and put him in the control of men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the Son of Man will be betrayed into the hands of men

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "eat whatever food they give you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: eat what is set before you

contextId.information: Jesus uses a question to rebuke the people of Capernaum for their pride. AT: "you will certainly not go up to heaven!" or "God will not honor you!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: do you think you will be exalted to heaven?

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you will go down to Hades" or "God will send you to Hades" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you will be brought down to Hades

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God has written your names in heaven" or "your names are on the list of people who are citizens of heaven" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: your names are engraved in heaven

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "My Father has handed everything over to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: All things have been entrusted to me from my Father

contextId.information: This metaphor speaks about the person as if they were a house that is swept clean and things put in their place. It is implied that the house is still empty. This can be stated in active form with that information made explicit. AT: "finds that the person is like a house that someone has swept clean and put everything where it belongs, but left it empty." or "finds that the person is like a  house that is clean and organized, but empty" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: finds that house swept out and put in order

contextId.information: This could be stated in active form. AT: "that the people killed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: who was killed

contextId.information: "everything that is hidden will be shown." This can be stated in active form. AT: "people will find out about everything that people do secretly" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: there is nothing concealed that will not be revealed

contextId.information: "will be shouted loudly." This can be stated in active form. AT: "people will proclaim" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: will be proclaimed

contextId.information: This could be stated in active form and in positive form. AT: "God never forgets any of them" (UDB) or "God indeed remembers every sparrow" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
contextId.quote: not one of them is forgotten in the sight of God

contextId.information: "he will be forgiven." This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will forgive him for that" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it will be forgiven him

contextId.information: This can be expressed with an active verb. AT: "God will not forgive him." When someone does not forgive someone, it means that he considers him guilty. AT: "God will consider him guilty forever" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
contextId.quote: it will not be forgiven

contextId.information: "these things also will be given to you." "These things" refers to food and clothing. This could be stated in active form. AT: "God will give you these things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: these things will be added to you

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "he would not have let the thief break into his house" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he would not have let his house be broken into

contextId.information: "will be hit many times" or "will be whipped many times." This can be stated in active form. AT: "his master will hit him many times" or "his master will punish him severely" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: will be beaten with many blows

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "They will require more of anyone who has received much" or "The master will require more of everyone he has given much to" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: But everyone who has been given much, from them much will be required

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the one to whom the master has given much property to take care of" or "the one to whom the master has given much responsibility" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the one who has been entrusted with much

contextId.information: "Woman, you are healed from your disease." This can be expressed with an active verb: AT: "Woman, I have set you free from your weakness" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Woman, you are freed from your weakness

contextId.information: This could be stated in active form. AT: "she stood up straight" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: she was straightened up

contextId.information: This could be stated in active form. AT: "let someone heal you during those six days" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: be healed then

contextId.information: This could be stated in active form. AT: "will God save only a few people?" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: are only a few people to be saved?

contextId.information: "but you yourselves will have been thrown outside." This can be stated in active form. AT: "but God will have forced you outside" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: but you are thrown out

contextId.information: It may be helpful to identify these people, and to state this in active form. AT: "those whom the leader of the Pharisees had invited to the meal" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: those who were invited

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "When someone invites you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: When you are invited by someone

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "because the host may have invited a person who is more important than you are" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: because someone may have been invited who is more honored than you

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "in this way they will repay you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you will be repaid

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will bless you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you will be blessed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will repay you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you will be repaid

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "those he had invited" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: those who were invited

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "whom I invited" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: who were invited

contextId.information: Jesus uses a question to teach the crowd. AT: "it cannot be made salty again" or "no one can make it salty again" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: how can it be made salty again?

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Someone just throws it away" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: It is thrown away

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "when I lose my management job" or "when my master takes away my management job" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: when I am removed from my management job

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I am teaching people about the gospel of the kingdom of God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the gospel of the kingdom of God is preached

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "People had laid a certain beggar named Lazarus at his gate" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
contextId.quote: A certain beggar named Lazarus was laid at his gate

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God has placed a huge ravine between you and us" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: a great chasm has been put in place

contextId.information: These can be stated in active form. AT: "Uproot yourself and plant yourself in the sea" or "Take your roots out of the ground, and put your roots down into the ocean" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Be uprooted, and be planted in the sea

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "ten men who were lepers met him" or "ten men who had leprosy met him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: there he was met by ten men who were lepers

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "parents were allowing their daughters to marry men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: they were given in marriage

contextId.information: "One person will be taken and the other person will be left behind." This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will take one person and leave the other" or "Angels will take one and leave behind the other" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: One will be taken, and the other will be left

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will humble" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: will be humbled

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that the prophets have written" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that have been written by the prophets

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "will happen" or "will occur" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: will be accomplished

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "they will mock him, treat him shamefully, and spit on him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: will be mocked, and shamefully treated, and spit upon

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God prevented them from understanding the meaning of what he was telling them" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: this word was hidden from them

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "to come to him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: to be called to him

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The two disciples that Jesus sent" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Those who were sent

contextId.information: This is a quotation from Isaiah. This can be stated in active form. AT: "The scriptures say" or "A prophet wrote these words in the scriptures" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: It is written

contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) "you tell the truth even if important people do not like it" (UDB) or 2) "you do not favor one person over another" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: are not influenced by anyone's position

contextId.information: The word "even" is here because the Sadducees might not have been surprised that some scriptures say that the dead are raised, but they did not expect Moses to have written something like that. AT: "But even Moses showed that dead people rise from the dead" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: But that the dead are raised, even Moses showed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "enemies will not leave any stone on top of another" (See [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]]).
contextId.quote: not one stone will be left on another

contextId.information: This can be translated as a new sentence. AT: "They will all be torn down" or "Enemies will tear down every stone" (See [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: which will not be torn down

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "even your parents, brothers, relatives, and friends will hand you over to the authorities" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you will be delivered up also by parents, brothers, relatives and friends

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "their enemies will capture them and take them to other countries" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: they will be led captive into all the nations

contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) the Gentiles will conquer Jerusalem and occupy it or 2) the Gentiles will destroy the city of Jerusalem or 3) the Gentiles will destroy the people of Jerusalem. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Jerusalem will be trampled by the Gentiles

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the period of the Gentiles has come to an end" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the times of the Gentiles are fulfilled

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. Possible meanings are 1) the things in the sky like the sun, moon, and stars will not move in their normal way. AT: "God will shake the powerful things in the heavens" or 2) the powerful spirits in the heavens will be distressed. The first is recommended. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the powers of the heavens will be shaken

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. Possible meanings are 1) until the purpose of the Passover Festival is accomplished. AT: "until God fulfills it" or "until God completes the purpose of the Passover Festival" or 2) "until we celebrate the final Passover Festival" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: until it is fulfilled

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "my body, which I will give for you" or "my body, which I will sacrifice for you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: my body which is given for you

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "But woe to the man who betrays the Son of Man!" or "But how terrible it will be for that man who betrays the Son of Man!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: But woe to that man through whom he is betrayed!

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the people would think was most important" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: was considered to be greatest

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "what a prophet wrote about me in the scriptures" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: what is written about me

contextId.information: The apostles would have understood that God would cause everything written in the scriptures to happen. AT: "God will fulfill" or "God will cause to happen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: must be fulfilled

contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) "For what the prophet predicted about me is about to happen" or 2) "For my life is coming to an end" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: For what is predicted about me is being fulfilled

contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) "The elders had Jesus brought into the council" or 2) "The guards led Jesus into the council of the elders." Some languages may avoid saying who led him by using the pronoun "they" (ULB) or by using a passive verb: "Jesus was led into the council" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: They led him into the council

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "to see him perform some kind of miracle" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: to see some miracle done by him

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "for Pilate to have his soldiers crucify Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: for him to be crucified

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The soldiers led away with Jesus two criminals to execute them also" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Other men, two criminals, were led away with him to be put to death

contextId.information: "the curtain of the temple was torn from top to bottom into two pieces." This can be stated in active form. AT: "God tore the temple curtain into two pieces from the top to the bottom" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the curtain of the temple was split down the middle

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "all the things that had happened" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: what was done

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "what had happened" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: things that were done

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "which someone had cut in a rock cliff" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that was cut in stone

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the women saw how the men laid Jesus' body inside the tomb" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: how his body was laid

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that someone had rolled the stone" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the stone rolled away

contextId.information: "but he has been made alive again!" (UDB). This can be stated in active form. AT: "because God has made him alive again!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: but has been raised!

contextId.information: The phrase "must be" means this is something that would certainly happen because God had already decided that it would happen. AT: "it was necessary that they hand the Son of Man over to sinful men so they can nail him to a cross" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the Son of Man must be delivered up into the hands of sinful men and be crucified

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "in order for the governor to put Jesus to death by crucifying him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: to be condemned to death and crucified him

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "how they recognized Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: how Jesus was shown to them

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "all that Moses, the prophets, and the writers of the Psalms wrote about me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: all that was written in the law of Moses and the prophets and the Psalms

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God would fulfill" or "God would cause to happen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: must be fulfilled
